skill.name: ghostty
skill.description: Control Ghostty terminal emulator via CLI. Manage windows, tabs, splits, and configuration.
skill.summary: Control Ghostty terminal emulator via CLI. Manage windows, tabs, splits, and configuration.
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown documentation about Ghostty CLI commands. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond its own documentation file.

content.value_statement: Managing terminal windows and tabs manually slows down workflow. This skill provides a complete reference for Ghostty terminal emulator CLI commands. It enables quick window creation, tab management, split navigation, and configuration control without memorizing syntax.
actual_capabilities: Create and manage terminal windows and tabs
Navigate between split panes in multiple directions
Increase, decrease, or reset font size
List available themes, fonts, and keybindings
Show current configuration and validate config files
limitations: Ghostty terminal must be installed on the system
Only works on macOS with Ghostty installed at default location
Does not provide terminal automation within shell sessions
Requires Ghostty to be running for IPC actions to work

use_cases.title: Multi-pane development
use_cases.description: Create split terminal panes and navigate between them quickly for coding workflows

use_cases.title: Terminal workspace setup
use_cases.description: Launch terminal with specific configurations, themes, and working directories

use_cases.title: Workflow optimization
use_cases.description: Manage multiple terminal sessions with keyboard shortcuts and CLI commands

prompt_templates.title: List available actions
prompt_templates.prompt: What actions are available in Ghostty terminal emulator?

prompt_templates.title: Create new window
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new window in Ghostty terminal

prompt_templates.title: Navigate splits
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to the split pane below in Ghostty

output_examples.input: Create a new split to the right in Ghostty terminal
output: This creates a new pane split to the right of your current pane
Use ghostty +goto-split:right to navigate to it

best_practices: Use IPC commands with the +action syntax to control a running Ghostty instance
List available actions with ghostty +list-actions to discover new features
Validate configuration files before reloading to catch syntax errors
anti_patterns: Running ghostty commands without Ghostty installed will fail silently
Using IPC actions when Ghostty is not running will not work
Forgetting to use the + prefix for actions will treat them as arguments instead

faq.question: Where is Ghostty installed by default?
faq.answer: Ghostty is typically installed at /Applications/Ghostty.app/Contents/MacOS/ghostty on macOS.

faq.question: What actions can I perform on a running Ghostty instance?
faq.answer: You can create windows, tabs, splits, navigate between them, toggle fullscreen, and reload config.

faq.question: How do I list all available Ghostty themes?
faq.answer: Run ghostty +list-themes to see all available color themes.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads documentation. No data is collected or transmitted.

faq.question: Why are my ghostty commands not working?
faq.answer: Ensure Ghostty is installed and running. IPC actions require a running Ghostty instance.

faq.question: How is this different from other terminal skills?
faq.answer: This skill is specific to Ghostty and provides its unique IPC action system for window management.
